concept-wr.title: Networks for a Titanium Server Multi-Region Environment
concept-wr.shortdesc: For a Titanium Server Region system, the network requirements depend in part on the region configuration.

conbody.p: Titanium Server Region systems act as components of larger network systems. The following network configuration typically meets the requirements of such a system:
conbody.draft-comment: Consider if the term "shared" really requires the quotes. Why is this a special case of "shared"? Perhaps explain what "shared" means in this context prior to the list and then remove the quotes. I changed the capitalized "MUST NOT" to use <i> (this is the approved method of indicating emphasis, use sparingly).

li.p: An internal management network that is “shared” with other Regions
An infrastructure network, “shared” with other Regions (required for systems with storage hosts)
An OAM network, optionally “shared” with other Regions
One or more DATA Networks that must not be “shared” with other Regions

conbody.p: On moderately loaded systems, the OAM and data networks can be consolidated on the management or infrastructure interfaces.

note.p: You can enable secure HTTPS connectivity on the OAM network during system installation. For more information, see Titanium Server System Administration: .
